intro: Cryptoceras rutifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf cryptoceras, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
